titleStmt.title: W. C. Marshall et al. to Beriah Magoffin
CWG11242

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p:
Bracken County March 5th/62.
To his Excellency The Governor of Kentucky

Your petitioners citizens of said County of Bracken would most respectfully represent to your Excellency -- That at the present Mar Februay Term of the Bracken Circuit Court -- An Indictment was found against Johnson Mains charged with horse stealing -- and upon the trial of said case admited the fact that he had taken the horse from a neighbor without his permission for the purpose of paying a visit to his Brother who was in camp & a volunteer in Col Marshal Regiment distance about twenty miles -- said Johnson stated on said trial he had no intention of stealing the horse but intended returning the following day with him -- he did go to camp & left the horse in the Livery stable in Maysville Said Mains is quite a young man, of Respectable parentage and your petitioners are satisfied that should he be restored to Society as He would so deport himself -- that he would wipe out the stain of intentionally stealing -- and from that it was but a mere indiscretion that is not infrequently indulged in by neighbors -- we therefore respectfully ask that your Excellny will pardon him

W. C. Marshall
W I Fleming
John S Kirk
John W, Croswell
P, S, Blades
Wm Adams
V Weldin
P Dillz
J. T. McKibben
L Stroube
